title_sort: richard maurice bucke to walt whitman, 28 april 1890
title: Richard Maurice Bucke to Walt Whitman, 28 April 1890
text: London, Ont.,28 April 1890I have your card of 25th Am not well pleased that you continue to feel so miserable Had hoped that the effects of La Grippe would have passed off before thisI hope that Londoners will buy the 100 copies of big book—there is not much money in the sale but it looks well to see the "Englishers" after itBe sure and tell me when Lippincotts print the piece you sent them—or send me a copy What you say about Tennyson is the first I have heard of any special utterance of his in re "The Leaves" Is there any way of getting hold of what he and the Boston man said—Any thing really good and strong from Tennyson would be quite a benefit and help to usLove alwaysR M Bucke Richard Maurice Bucke to Walt Whitman, 28 April 1890
